direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with the connectionIdValue, one setting it and the other retrieving it.
Both methods handle the connectionIdValue, one setting it directly and the other decoding it from a byte array.
Both methods involve operations on the connectionIdValue, one setting it and the other encoding it into a byte array.
Both methods involve operations on the connectionIdValue, one setting it and the other comparing it.

enhanced_by.reason: Initialization of the ConnectionIdAttribute object is required before setting the connectionIdValue.
Decoding the attribute body is often required before setting the connectionIdValue, especially if the value is derived from a binary representation.
After setting the connectionIdValue, verifying it by retrieving it can be part of the assertion process.
Comparing the ConnectionIdAttribute object with another instance can be part of the assertion process to ensure the connectionIdValue is correctly set.
